bill_title: place restrictions on the use of certain animal traps.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to place restrictions on the use of certain animal traps. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may install any conibear, body, or leghold animal trap within one thousand three hundred twenty feet of any occupied dwelling unless the person informs the owner or lessee of the dwelling of the location and characteristics of the trap and posts a sign no more than twenty feet from the trap to inform passersby of the location and characteristics of the trap. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify requirements and methods to meet the notification and posting requirements of this section and to specify the types and characteristics of traps that are governed by this section. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to place restrictions on the use of certain animal traps. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may install on any public right-of-way any conibear, body, or leghold animal trap within one thousand three hundred twenty feet of any occupied dwelling unless the person informs the owner or lessee of the dwelling of the location and characteristics of the trap and posts a sign no more than twenty feet from the trap to inform passersby of the location and characteristics of the trap. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify requirements and methods to meet the notification and posting requirements of this section and to specify the types and characteristics of traps that are governed by this section. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
